 The low level generates an interrupt request.

 The high level generates an interrupt request (valid only for arm and avr32).
#define IRQ_ANY_EDGE   2
 Any edge generates an interrupt request (valid only for avr and xmega).
#define IRQ_FALLING_EDGE   3
 Falling edge generates an interrupt request.
#define IRQ_RISING_EDGE   4
 Rising edge generates an interrupt request.
#define IRQ_IS_DISABLED   5
 interrupt is disabled. (valid only for xmega)
#define IRQ_IS_NOT_CHANGED   6
 interrupt is not changed previous state. (valid only for xmega)

Detailed Description

The header file describes the IRQ interface.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum HAL_IrqNumber_t

numbers of possible interrupt.

Enumerator:
IRQ_0 

number of valid interrupt for arm and avr32.

IRQ_1 

number of valid interrupt for arm and avr32.

IRQ_2 

number of valid interrupt for avr32.

IRQ_3 

number of valid interrupt for avr32.

IRQ_4 

number of valid interrupt for avr32.

IRQ_5 

number of valid interrupt for avr(only rcb platform) and avr32.

IRQ_6 

number of valid interrupt for avr and avr32.

IRQ_7 

number of valid interrupt for avr and avr32.

Definition at line 56 of file irq.h.

Function Documentation

int HAL_RegisterIrq ( HAL_IrqNumber_t  irqNumber,
HAL_IrqMode_t  irqMode,
void(*)(void)  f 
)

Registers the user's irqNumber external interrupt.

Parameters:
[in]irqNumber- IRQ number. Must be chosen from:
IRQ_0 (for arm and avr32)
IRQ_1 (for arm and avr32)
IRQ_2 (for avr32)
IRQ_3 (for avr32)
IRQ_4 (for avr32)
IRQ_5 (for avr (only rcb platform) and avr32)
IRQ_6 (for avr and avr32)
IRQ_7 (for avr and avr32)
IRQ_PC (for xmega. P - port name, C - interrupt number. For example: IRQ_D1)
IRQ_PORT_x (for cortex m3, x stands for port name)
[in]irqMode- Controls the sort of interrupt. For avr and arm must be chosen from:
IRQ_LOW_LEVEL // The low level generates an interrupt request.
IRQ_HIGH_LEVEL // The high level generates an interrupt request (valid for arm, avr32, cortex m3).
IRQ_ANY_EDGE // Any edge generates an interrupt request (valid for avr and cortex m3).
IRQ_FALLING_EDGE // Falling edge generates an interrupt request.
IRQ_RISING_EDGE // Rising edge generates an interrupt request.

irqMode is bit field for xmega . Bit field includes members pinX (X - pin number of selected port).
All members that bit field must have value:

IRQ_LOW_LEVEL // The low level generates an interrupt request.
IRQ_ANY_EDGE // Any edge generates an interrupt request.
IRQ_FALLING_EDGE // Falling edge generates an interrupt request.
IRQ_RISING_EDGE // Rising edge generates an interrupt request.
IRQ_IS_DISABLED // Pin is disabled for interrupt request.
IRQ_IS_NOT_CHANGED // Pin is not changed previous state.

Parameters:
[in]f- user's interrupt handler. Handler must be executed less than 100 us.
Returns:
-1 - if irqNumber is out of range,
not valid irq mode,
such interrupt has been already registered.
0 - otherwise.
int HAL_EnableIrq ( HAL_IrqNumber_t  irqNumber)

Enables the irqNumber interrupt.

Parameters:
[in]irqNumber- IRQ number
Returns:
-1 - if irqNumber is out of range or has not been registered yet.
0 - otherwise.
int HAL_DisableIrq ( HAL_IrqNumber_t  irqNumber)

Disables the irqNumber interrupt.

Parameters:
[in]irqNumber- IRQ number
Returns:
-1 - if irqNumber is out of range or has not been registered yet.
0 - otherwise.
int HAL_UnregisterIrq ( HAL_IrqNumber_t  irqNumber)

Unregisters the user's irqNumber interrupt.

Parameters:
[in]irqNumber- IRQ number
Returns:
-1 - if irqNumber is out of range or has not been registered yet.
0 - otherwise.
